body_html:
The problem is even more tricky for cc_tests.
Every cc_test is binary exe on Windows, it may either link to tf framework libraries statically or dynamically.
For link statically, you should define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY, otherwise, you must be care of not defining it.
For every cc file under tensorflow/core, we need to define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY while compiling.
For every cc file under tensorflow/contrib, we need to undefine TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY while compiling.
To accomplish that, we have to add tf_copts everywhere.

Every cc_test is binary exe on Windows, it may either link to tf framework libraries statically or dynamically.
For link statically, you should define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY, otherwise, you must be care of not defining it.
For every cc file under tensorflow/core, we need to define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY while compiling.
For every cc file under tensorflow/contrib, we need to undefine TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY while compiling.
To accomplish that,  we have to add tf_copts everywhere.
body:
The problem is even more tricky for cc_tests. 
Every cc_test is binary exe on Windows, it may either link to tf framework libraries statically or dynamically.
For link statically, you should define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY, otherwise, you must be care of not defining it. 
For every cc file under tensorflow/core, we need to **define** TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY while compiling.
For every cc file under tensorflow/contrib, we need to **undefine** TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY while compiling.
To accomplish that,  we have to add tf_copts everywhere.
